Key Match Events: Otto López was a triple shy of the cycle.
Connor Norby homered and drove in three runs.
Xavier Edwards and Nick Fortes had two hits each.
Javier Sanoja made his major league debut with a pinch hit appearance in the seventh.
John McMillon pitched 1 1/3 innings of scoreless relief for the win.
Phillies starter Aaron Nola allowed five runs and nine hits over 4 2/3 innings.
Miami worked long counts against Nola, who finished with 101 pitches.
Jesús Sánchez added an RBI single in the sixth.
The Marlins padded their lead with a three-run seventh against former starter Taijuan Walker.
Philadelphia’s Kyle Schwarber hit a tying sacrifice fly in the third inning for his 93rd RBI of the season.
Norby hit a two-run homer in the first to put Miami ahead 2-1.
Marlins starter Darren McCaughan allowed three runs and six hits in 4 2/3 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker commented on the team's performance, stating, '(Friday) was not great. Today was a lot better.'

Phillies manager Rob Thomson reflected on Aaron Nola's performance, saying, 'I think just command of the baseball. He just missed the glove a lot — a lot more than he normally does — and he paid for it.'
Otto López commented on the team's strategy against Nola, saying, 'He’s an amazing pitcher and today the plan was let him pitch. His command is amazing so we wanted to stretch out the pitches.'
Javier Sanoja expressed his feelings about his debut, stating, 'I wanted to go out there and be aggressive. Unfortunately, I didn’t get my first hit but I was able to get the RBI.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillies catcher J.T. Realmuto has some swelling but will remain with the club as he recovers from a left knee contusion.
The Phillies selected the contract of catcher Aramis Garcia from Triple-A Lehigh Valley and designated RHP Nick Nelson for assignment.

Marlins placed RHP Max Meyer (right shoulder bursitis) and RHP Calvin Faucher (right shoulder impingement) on the 15-day injured list and OF Derek Hill (right shoulder impingement) on the 10-day injured list.
LHP Andrew Nardi (left elbow muscle) was transferred to the 60-day injured list.
Others: RHP Seth Johnson will make his major league debut when he starts the series finale for the Phillies on Sunday.
The Marlins have not announced a starter but RHP Edward Cabrera could get the nod when he cleared all tests after he withdrew from his scheduled start Friday because of migraine-like symptoms.
